title: KL thrills by Vespa
body: This tour was the surprise highlight of our KL trip!  My girlfriend and I had such a memorable time with Dass/Kelvin as we explored the city center by bike.  The Vespa ride through the crowded streets of KL was fun and at certain points thrilling as we weaved through the traffic.  Dass/Kelvin kept us safe during the entirety of the ride.  We were able to enjoy the city lights and attractions at night, when the weather was cooler and there was less people.  We went to spots both local and tourist in nature, spots with rich history, spots we wouldn’t have seen without their guidance.  Dass/Kelvin helped to give us a better appreciation of the diverse culture, history and food scene present in KL.  Much thanks to these two for the experience!  We wouldrecommended it to anyone looking to explore the city limits!

title: This was waaaaay more than a food tour!
body: Our passionate guides (Kelvin, Des, Azmi) showed us a KL like we never would have seen alone. The food spots we stopped at were little local joints. We had Chinese/malay, Indian/malay, and Malay food. Everything was DELICIOUS! We tried durian and lots of tropical fruits. We went to little laneways to see street art and to independence square. Through out Kelvin shared the history of KL with us (from architecture to politics) The bikes were great fun, having never ridden before I was nervous but the guys were very safe and made meFeel at ease. I would 100 percent recommend this experience to everyone. Kelvin and des clearly have a huge passion for their city and were joyful to be around.

title: Best food tour !
body: I had a great time with my Vespalicious guide, Kelvin, zipping through the streets of KL. I saw another side of the city and felt like a local. I tried the spiciest, tastiest laksa at our first stop, along with some delicious freshly made noodles at Pudu Wai Sek Kai. Kelvin managed to accommodate all my food requests. He even picked up some durian when I said I hadn’t tried it - was better than anticipated! Would highly recommend this tour as an intro into the KL food scene/ nightlife.

title: Fantastic way to see KL
body: What a fun evening. We zipped through traffic to spots that aren’t typically on a food tour. The Chinese food stop was amazing. We loved Brickfields and yummy Indian food. We were full after that so Zak, Das and Lisa took us on a tour of the major sites. Great time and highly recommended!

title: Incredible night in KL. Highly recommend! Food, sights, history and vespas!
body: Absolutely 5 stars!! Lisa, Zac and Das were wonderful hosts and tour guides as we zipped about KL on our food tour. Professional, safe drivers, and an abundance of amazing food in the 3 main districts of KL - Chinatown, Indian Brickfields and Malay. Lisa took time taking stunning pics and videos which she stared with us and also explained key history of each place we visited and their food.

title: the top experience in KL
body: one of the most experience you can do in Kl!!!! my new friend Kelvin conduced me in the middle of the town discovering Kuala Lumpur in a tour with very local traditions...historical but also not only typical places, attractions of KL and naturally different stops for foods and beverages sometimes strange and particular in other stops more traditional in different areas amd all very good and tasting..a lot of food!all was amazing, the guide is very expert and nice and the experience is for a time sufficient arouns 4-5 hours to discover at 360 grades the city!the best!

title: KL authentic food highlights
body: This is a very nice way to experience authentic food and get the best views of KL by night. The Vespa rider Kuna and guide Kelvin did everything to make it a nice enjoyable evening.

title: Super fun!!!!
body: This was such an awesome experience and our guide Kelvin was amazing! We got to see a side of Kuala Lumpur that I never would have been able to see on my own! I had never been on a Vespa before so that was exhilarating and I had some of the best food of my life! Would %100 recommend to anyone coming to Kuala Lumpur!

title: Fabulous KL food tour
body: Thanks to Lisa, Dass and Zaq We had a fantastic night of food and fun in KLIt was a great opportunity to visit all the places we wouldn’t normally see. They were all very professional and friendly.My wife has mobility issues but they adapted our trip to suit with no fuss. The food was delicious and plentiful. We would highly recommend this trip to anyone. P&S (from UK)

title: Fun tour!!
body: Seriously, you must do this tour.  So much fun, delicious food, good value, great company to deal with.  Thank you!

title: Great introduction to the city and the cultures
body:
Definitely recommended! We did this tour on our first day in KL, with little knowledge about the city and the country. At the end we felt we'd been in Malaysia for years already and knew the culture really well. It also felt like we'd been to 3 different cities, with visiting a Chinese food street, an Indian area and a very local Malay settlement. The tour guide and the drivers are very knowledgeable and also interested in us. We spent so much time talking that sometimes one of the drivers had to remind us to go to the next stop.
The food was all delicious, tried a lot of new things and it was very varied.

title: Amazing, fun way to experience Kuala Lumpur
body: Chose this tour as our final activity on our honeymoon and it was amazing. We only had 1 full day in KL and this tour allowed us to really get a feel for the city. We got picked up and dropped off at our hotel, we zoomed around KL snaking in and out of traffic (very exciting), our guides Lisa and Kingston were amazing and the very patient, lovely Vespa drivers were superb! We tried all kinds of exciting food and drinks, saw amazing areas and sights and generally had a fantastic time! A brilliant and fun way to experience the city. Highly recommended! A huge thank you to all the team for making our last night so special.

title: An amazing way to discover the city
body: A great way to discover the city. Cruising around on a vespa and trying delicious food! I would highly recommend this tour.

title: Night Food Tour on Vespas
body: Had a fabulous time with Kelvin and Lisa driving around KL sampling Indian, Chinese and Malaysian food as well as taking in some of the sights. Great fun. This is the trip to do if you are in KL.😊

title: Exceeded all of our Vespectations!
body: This was a fantastic experience which surpassed our expectations. The Vespalicious team were so friendly and knowledgeable about the city, the history and the food and having the Vespas allowed us to experience a wider view of the KL and everything it has to offer. Highly recommended for a fun evening, sampling a wide range of dishes - you’ll get to go to several places off the beaten track of the tourist trail in KL. A must do!

title: Best night in KL ever
body: There are no words to describe the absolutely amazing experience we had with Lisa, Euson and Azmi. What a night full of laughter, food and learning the culture and history of KL. The best thing is we have walked away with friends.

title: Well worth it!
body: Fantastic tour. What a great evening.  I did this tour with my son, who is 18 and we both had a brilliant time.  Without a doubt one of the best things we did in KL.  Lisa, Azmi and Daas really went the extra mile to make the tour fun and engaging. We also got to sample some of the varying tastes of KL.

title: Not sure this tour is still operating? July 2022
body:
July 2022…. I don’t think the tour is active? Sharing my experience if helpful….
I booked and paid for this tour but it remained ‘pending’ with email confirmation. 4 hours before the tour I called the contact number listed and was told it was a wrong number. Viator responded quickly and efficiently but could only tell me it was pending. Having waited 45 minutes in hotel reception I’m assuming it’s cancelled. Just hope I’m refunded quickly.
Better timely communications if the tour is not happening as I’ve wasted time and opportunity to make alternative plans. I also now have hassle of sorting a refund!!

title: Book a Vespalicious tour of KL!
body: Wow! Best thing to do in KL. Lisa, Azally and Daas were more than we could have hoped for. Owner Kingston met us at the first market to make sure we got a table and didn’t have to line up. We were taken to places that tourists didn’t know about, for legitimate Chinese, Malay & Indian food. This came with historical information about this beautiful city. Lisa was so knowledgeable. And Daas and Azally were amazing too. We both felt safe with them on the Vespa’s. We would highly recommend this tour if you are ever in KL.

title: Absolute MUST if you're in Kuala Lumpur for the first time
body:
An absolute MUST if you're visiting Kuala Lumpur for the first time! Kingston and Das took me to three different spots, thoughtfully curated such that I get to try Chinese food, Indian food and Malaysian food at spots that are frequented by locals (I didn't see a single tourist at these spots, other than myself of course). You'll get to try numerous dishes throughout the few hours, so best to eat a bit of each and leave room for the next few stops. Through the wide variety of food, you really get a taste of the diversity that makes Malaysia unique.

Along the way, you'll also get to visit landmark spots in KL, and at each place, Kingston shares pockets of Malaysian history and the importance of what you're seeing. Learned so much from this tour! And the best part of it is the passion that the guides have. You can really tell they love sharing knowledge about Malaysia and genuinely enjoying chatting with you. The cherry on top, of course, is that you get to ride a vespa throughout the city. Say what! Cute photos of you on the vespa are guaranteed to impress your instagram followers ;)

title: Something different to try
body: Took this trip out of city to see fireflies.  Stopped on the way to see monkeys which I was happy to look at from a distance and glad that they didn’t interact with you unless you bought the food to entice them on your back. The meal provided was excellent ( I don’t eat shellfish)  there was chicken and veggies available. The boat trip was better than we expected. Not crowded and we saw lots of fireflies.

title: Worth a look but just be wary of online ticket purchase.
body: When we arrived at the desk there was some confusion over the online tickets I had bought. I was told I needed to get new tickets (cash only)?? Tour itself was okay but with a little wind there were only a few fireflies.

title: Don’t waste your time
body: Long drive to see very little.  Waste of time and money.  Fireflies are stable and in the bushes.  Yes, you do see the light.  Almost nonexistent blue algae.  We were given nets on a stick to stir the water and generate minute specs of color.  Paid extra ten dollars each to see “blue” tiers..  lol.Our driver was nice and professional.

title: Really enjoyable tour, LG was great!
body: The tour was great, we got time inside the Sri Shakti Temple (I was only expecting a photo stop), visit Melawati Hill and see the views and monkeys, buy our own dinner (because we didn't like the set seafood dinner tours), boat ride and fireflies. As with all things nature, its a bit of luck on whether you interact with monkeys and see fireflies. The success for our tour really comes down our driver and guide LG. It was raining in KL, it was a Saturday, traffic was bad meaning timing was tight, but we still got to through the itinerary, we didn't feel rushed, LG gave just the right amount of commentary, got us up Melawati Hill, and liaised with the boat company to get us sorted on the busy jetty. A very safe pair of hands. Re: the fireflies, there is a number of reviews that question whether its worth the tour. IMHO, sure they are like low wattage xmas lights, I'd recommend doing it if you haven't seen them before and because its an experience in a new country on top of the temple, hill, monkeys, commentary and boat ride.

title: No fireflies
body: Do not do this.We were forced to step in the boat when is was not yet dark.So no fireflies. But in stead of waiting they returned to pick up next touristsDisappointing. Especially for kids.

title: Disappointing
body: We were too early for a good view of the fireflies and we paid extra to do the blue tears also but disappointed as the water was very coffee coloured and very little phosphorus

title: Excellent value
body: This was such a fantastic trip, seeing the fireflies were amazing, our guide was amazing, very helpful and knowledgeable

title: Absolutely amazing
body: The tour was better than expected. Our tour guide picked us up from our accommodation and was very knowledgeable pointing out things of interest along the way. First stop was the Hindu temple and it was quite amazing. We were told the history of the temple and all about its construction. Second stop was the monkeys. Wasn’t expecting this part and it was absolutely amazing!The third and final stop was the fireflies tour itself. If you forget to take insect repellant, don’t panic, you can get it there for 5 MYR.It was about an hours boat ride out and back and the fireflies are pretty spectacular, especially once it gets darker.We had a great time on this tour and it’s been one of the highlights of our trip.I’d highly recommend doing this if you’re in Malaysia!

title: Was okay
body: The excursion was “Okay”- would not recommend if you have limited time in the country/ as a main plan. The fireflies view was underwhelming. The highlight of the trip was the silverback monkeys. My Son really enjoyed that (9). This would be a nice experience as just something to do on a chill day.

title: Fire fly Experience
body: It was a amazing experience and the tour guide was friendly and informative. All went smooth, all spots were visited.
